Name: Ananya

College: M.S. Ramaiah University of Applied Sciences - [MSRUAS]

Name: Aditi
College: IIT BHU - Indian Institute of Technology
Heading: My review of IIT BHU
Review: Placement opportunities are less for the M.Sc students. Most of them prefer to go in teaching line. In my batch, very less students sat for the placements. Highest CTC went to Rs.1.03 CPA and international CTC was Rs. 1.53 CPA.

Name: Anuj Shandilya
College: IIT Ropar - Indian Institute of Technology - [IITR]
Heading: IIT Ropar: My Beautiful Journey
Review: IIT Ropar Placement percentage is 84.96%. A total of 96 students got placed among 113 registered students. The top sectors in the placement drive are IT, Finance, Consulting, Core Engineering. Unlike other IITs, IIT Ropar has top PSU recruiters such as DRDO, ISRO, Indian navy, Coal India, Hindustan Petroleum, Indian Oil, and ONGC. The median salary provided was ₹12 lakh per annum.  Top recruiters: Google, Microsoft, Amazon, Directi, Ericsson. I was not placed with any firm but I started my own business after clearing my master's.

Name: Abhinav Singh
College: IIT Jodhpur - Indian Institute of Technology - [IITJ]

Name: Mitesh
College: Charotar University of Science and Technology - [CHARUSAT]
Heading: Detail view of Course
Review:
My main reason for choosing these courses is I have to go for software and hardware on both sides so I choose computer science and engineering (CSE).

Maximum teachers qualification is minimum up to bachelors were some teachers qualifications are PhD and masters also

They can term exam regular base every semester has 2 internal and 1 external and external viva also in that external viva is very difficult to pass many student gets reviva.

Name: M SATWIK RAI
Heading: OVERVIEW NMAMIT
Review:
I am currently pursuing electrical and electronics engineering. NMAMIT is one of the reputed colleges in Mangalore.
it is an autonomous college. The faculty-student ratio is balanced. There is no shortage of lecturers. Most of the lecturers have doctorate degrees. Exams are conducted on time, but due to the pandemic, there were few inconveniences.

Name: Nikita
Heading: Government Polytechnic, Dhanbad a good place to kick start your engineering journey
Review:
Campus life here is not that great at all but good in some manners.
There is no annual fest or tech fest taking place but many festivals and other National days are celebrated with great enthusiasm.
Books and journals of all types are available in Library, one can read there and can also issue the books from there but you must submit the book before leaving college meaning after the completion of your course for not doing so will result in fines and obstruction in obtaining your certificates and other documents.
Classrooms are well lit and ventilated. Big halls are also there for big lectures by external faculties. All classrooms have full benches and tables and in each classroom, there is a projector for smart teaching.
There are no extracurricular activities apart from ones which are conducted by TATA Strive for their soft skill training program.
There are no social groups or websites run by students here but all are connected to each other through WhatsApp groups and Google classroom.

Name: Gyana Ranjan
Heading: Recommended college in this area
Review: As this is semi govt college, the course fee is not that high. Only admission fees and some registration fee are applicable. There are many government scholarship like Prerana Pragati E-medhabruti etc are introduced to students. The students are getting good scholarships amount that helps in there study expenses. There are no fixed changes in fee each year. There are not  so that campus placement program inside the campus as far as I know. But students are getting good career option after this and doing good jobs in various departments. Some scholar students are also getting stipend from different merit programmes and competitions.

Name: Harshal jaiswal
College: Institute of Engineering and Technology, Devi Ahilya University - [IET -DAVV]
Heading: Truth  about the college
Review:
In my knowledge there two fests which were conducted in the college which are named as YOUTH FESTIVAL and the other is AKSHANK , akshank is a cultural festival in which many competitions and activities are performed. 
And Youth Festival is like a inter college competition in various categories like solo singing,solo dancing, group dancing and so on . Whichever festival is conducted that will be informed by the respective HODs.
In the library , there are many books available and we can issue any book there.
Now we talk about the sports , their are many indoor and outdoor games like football , cricket, volleyball, table tennis , badminton, and there is a synthetic track also.

Name: Harshal jaiswal
Heading: Newbie's Exp.
Review:
I would directly tell that I have choosen int. M.tech course because of fee , for b.tech courses fee were very high. And hence my course is having benefits also as in 5yrs i will get b.tech and m.tech degree both.
Here in VIT, Bhopal  there is doctorare faculty.  
Every teacher is experienced and having doctorate degree which is unique in private uni.
Now, about the exams there are two main exams held in a sem. That are 1st  CET which is held after two months of classes started which means exam between half of sem.
And the 2nd exam is TEE i.e. term end exam which is held when sem ends 
As between the  exams there are many assignments , tutorials and quizes have to be done . These all depends upon the faculty when they want to take. For assignments some time period will be given else tutorials and quizes are done in the class mostly or by end of the day.

Name: Shivani
College: Raj Kumar Goel Institute of Technology - [RKGIT]
Heading: All is well.
Review: The faculties of our college are very good in their own field. They are very supportive of students and college. They guide students for their professional future. Maximum teachers in our college have PhD and master's qualifications. If we talk about faculty and student ratio we can say it's good because faculties are sufficient with students. Our college provides us calendar in starting of the year so we all know about exam time, event time and holidays. So we all are going according to that calender and completing our syllabus at a time for the exam. Our college takes 2 sessional tests and one pre-university test in one semester. That sessional and pre-university test is very helpful for our university exam. The time of the exam is 3 hours. That is sufficient for attempting all questions in the exam. In our exam there are three sections short type, long type and options are also given in long type questions so we have relief there. So we can say it's not difficult to pass if you are an average student.
